summary: This is a letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to defense counsel in the case against Ghislaine Maxwell, detailing a large production of discovery materials. The materials include extensive financial records from multiple banks for Jeffrey Epstein, Ghislaine Maxwell, and related entities, as well as other files, all governed by a protective order.

events.title: Protective Order Issued
events.description: A protective order was issued in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, governing the confidentiality of discovery materials.

events.title: Defense Request for Files
events.description: The defense sent a letter specifying files they requested, which the government is reproducing in this production.

events.title: Discovery Production to Defense
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office produces a massive volume of discovery materials to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team, including financial records and other files.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
Cohen & Gresser LLP, 800 Third Avenue, New York, NY 10022
Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C., 150 East Tenth Avenue, Denver, CO 80203
keyFacts: The government produced a vast discovery set (over 150,000 pages based on Bates numbers) to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team, including financial records from Deutsche Bank, JPMorgan Chase, Citibank, UBS, and American Express.
The American Express records pertain to both Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell, directly linking their financial activities.

UBS records were produced for entities and trusts associated with Ghislaine Maxwell, including Angara Trust, Montepelier Trust, Terramar Project, Inc., Max Foundation, Ghislaine Maxwell IRA, and Ellmax, LLC.
All produced materials are governed by a confidential protective order dated July 31, 2020.
The document indicates the investigation involved detailed forensic financial analysis, with instructions provided for opening specialized file formats like .dat, .dvt, and .vol files.
